subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] ANNOUNCE: Configuratronic.with a	n actual link
msgSnippet: I can t get the check boxes to do anything, personally. I only see the quikscript and the IPA. The IPA is helpful, though. I m using Firefox. ... From: Nathan
messageBody:
I can't get the check boxes to do anything, personally. I only see the quikscript and the IPA. The IPA is helpful, though.
 
I'm using Firefox.
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From: Nathan Sharfi
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, November 17, 2010 10:29 PM
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] ANNOUNCE: Configuratronicwith an actual link

 

Boy, first post to the list and I leave out a link to the thing I'm trying to share with everyone.

Anyhow:

http://adiabatic.github.com/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet/

and, if you want to poke around on the back end:

https://github.com/adiabatic/Configuratronic-Quikscript-Cheat-Sheet

-------------------------

From the readme:

> Can't remember what sort of sound .Ox makes? Forgetting whether it's .Foot or .Ooze that looks like a U? The Configuratronic Quikscript Cheat Sheet can help.
>
> Works in:
>
> * Safari
> * MobileSafari
> * Chrome
> * Firefox
>
> Planned features, *if* anyone asks:
>
> * fonts other than Jerome
> * IE 9 support
> * newfangled (not Read's) names

The IPA (and X-SAMPA) values might be contentious; I'm simply going off message
number [2017][] and the IPA-for-English Wikipedia page as best I can; I'm
California-born and -raised. Similarly, I'm not sure if I should be using
brackets, slashes, or nothing at all there.

[2017]: http://groups.yahoo.com/group/Read_Alphabet/message/2017

Hope this is useful to someone other than me.

Cheers,

Nathan
